title: What is the highest tenor sax note? - Quora

response.answer_text: The highest note for most modern tenors with ordinary fingerings is the top space E on the treble clef. With advanced technique, some people can play as high as the concert C an octave above the c that’s two ledger lines above the treble clef. This is the note that singers call double high C. In other words, an octave above high C.

The sky is the limit. It takes some practice to do all the high notes. I get tired of doing it after a while. People start to expect it. You end up feeling like a guitar instead of a sax. That kind of playing is over rated. It really is better to be able to play the normal range in tune.
